ngoList.detailsOfAchievement: Through a registered Eye Hospital under the Trust, We have done the activities as follows In 2018-19 (June 2018 to March 2019) - Total No. of Free Eye Screening Camp Conducted - 76 - Total No. of Patients screened in Camp - 4700 - Cataract Identified - 2115 - Total Free Surgery done - 430 In 2019-20 (April 2019 to August 2019) - Total No. of Free Eye Screening Camp Conducted - 54 - Total No. of Patients screened in Camp - 2833 - Cataract Identified - 1163 - Total Free Surgery done - 200

sourceOfFunds.purpose: Trust was recently registered and facility of services (Eye Care/ hospital) were being established.

Vision Foundation of India jointly with Kotak Mahindra Bank Ltd has sponsored 200 cataract surgeries @ 1800/- per surgery to our Trust. In order to implement the project, they have released 50% of total amount sanctioned on 29th March 2019. We have started the activity in May 2019 and Completed in June 2019. So the Amount received has been utilized in 2019-20.

ngoList.detailsOfAchievement: State Resource Centre â€“DEEPAYATAN is an autonomous organisation registered under the Societies registration act 1860 and has been functioning since 1978-79 basically in field of the literacy The major areas of intervation have been imparting Training to field innovoation functionaries, developing teaching learning materials, contducting action research, promotional activities, project formalutation, project appraisal and monitoring. Since inception SRC-Deepayatan has close collaboration and partinership with several esteemed agencies/organizations of international and national repute such as UNICEF, UNESCO, BBC World Service Trust, UNFPA, DANIDA, DFID, BSACS, Mininary of Health & Family Welfare SLMA, etc. with a view to gaining wide spread exposure in social sector programmes including education, literacy, reproductive health, HIV and AIDS, Women & Child development etc. Thus, it has created enormous capabilities in extending its excellent academic and technical resource support in these areas. Apart from regular annual grant of 100% received from Govt. of India for functioning as SRC for literacy, Deepayatan has been undertaking several projects of various organisations from time to time. Deepayatan has a dedicated team of academicians with expertise in the field of training, Monitoring & evaluation, teaching learning material development and research etc. There is also a strong pool of Resource Persons i.e. trainers, artists, writers, activists avaialble at state and district levels. There is a strong liaisoning with various NGOs and Zila Saksharata Samities of 19 district of Bihar. Through the ZSSs we have direct access to the grass root functionaries from block to village levels in last three years. NLMA has assigned some innovative tasks to undertake in order to give a big push to the pace and progress of Saakshar Bharat Programme especially in the operational jurisdiction of SRC. Altogether, 326 Panchayats spread over 17 blocks of 4 districts namely Vaishali, Muzaffarpur, Kishanganj and East Champaran have been adopted by SRC-Deepayatan as per instruction of NLMA which is termed as "Islands of Success". Under Saakshar Bharat/Annual Action Plan of SRC-Deepayatan, primarily focus is given to those areas. Special interventions are planned to accelerate the pace of implementation intending to achieve the desired goal in a stipulated timeframe. Out of 326 LSKs running in Islands of Success, a few are to be chosen as model centres and special/innovative efforts are to be made therein. In Addition, in view of Inter Personal Media Campaign, lot of innovative efforts had been made in operational areas of SRC-Deepayatan to accelerate the academic activities so that the desired goal may be achieved in a short time span. Keeping in view Maulana Azad Taleem-E Baleegan Programme launched on 18th February, 2014 by the NLMA. SRC-Deepayatan extended its academic support in training to Madarsa representatives/teachers and volunteer teachers to run literacy classes among Muslims with special focus on women. SRC-Deepayatan had monitored the programme in all seven districts namely Purnea, Araria, Kishanganj, Katihar, Darbhanga, Sitamarhi and East Champaran adopted under MATBP: SRC-Deepayatan has been assigned the task to perform coordinative role in NIOS-Basic Literacy examination of learners since last three years.

ngoList.detailsOfAchievement: The State Resource Centre (SRC) Society ADRI has been functioning as a NGO and it has a mandate to provide comprehensive professional support to the adult literacy campaign in Bihar, supported by the National Literacy Mission Authority (NLMA) under the MHRD, New Delhi., The SRC has been functioning since 1995. but since 2007, as per the norms of NLMA, the SRC is functioning as an autonomous NGO with a Board of Director of its own and a Director as its executive head. There are 6 categories under which SRC provides professional services to the adult literacy campaign â€” (i) Training (ii) Materials Preparation, (iii) Environment Building & Awareness Camps (iv) Seminars Workshops and (v) Research. (i) The training agenda of SRC includes organisation of training for literacy functionaries at state, district, block and panchayat levels on the issues of â€” pedagogy, organisational management, administrative accounting skills and IT-skills. The trainees are â€” Key Resource Persons (KRP), Master Trainers (MT), Voluntary Teachers (VT), state officials, PRI members and other stakeholders. On an average, about 1500 persons are trained every year. (ii) Under Materials preparation, SRC prepares literacy primers, separately for each district, reflecting their own specificities, including dialect variations. Further, SRC also prepares books for continuing education of neo-literates on social, economic and cultural topics. Till date, SRC has prepared about â€” primers and â€” titles for the neo-literates. (iii) Towards creating an enthusing environment for adult literacy campaign in Bihar, apart from organising training programmes for local artists, SRC has also produced CDs and other IEC materials on adult education. Akshar Bihar, a joint literacy forum of SRC and Prabhat Khabar (a leading Hindi daily), is also managed by the SRC to seek the cooperation of local intelligentsia for the adult literacy campaign. The responsibility of creating wider awareness about the adult literacy is generally borne by literacy functionaries at the district block level. But SRC has been supplementing their effort by organising awareness camps for non-literate PRI members, who are expected to play a major in adult literacy campaign. In addition, under a Population Education programme, SRC has also organised awareness camps on health issues for HIV/AIDS, adolescent girls and inmates of red light areas. (iv) Since SRC activities are basically academics, organisation of seminars workshop is one of its regular activities. Apart from holding seminars workshop on many adult-literacy related concepts, SRC also organises an annual Myles Horton-Paulo Friere Memorial Lecture which has been delivered by very eminent scholars in the past. (v) The research activities of SRC mainly include evaluation exercises of adult literacy campaigns in adjoining states. But SRC has also conducted empirical studies to investigate the social impact of literacy in terms of fertility behaviour, women empowerment, enrolment of children in schools, health practices and the like. Although the literacy rates in Bihar are still the lowest in Bihar, the state has registered the highest decadal increase in literacy rate (17 percentage point) between 2001 and 2011. This was partly due to the success of adult literacy campaign in the state, supported by the SRC.

ngoList.title: SUGAM SAHITYA SANCHAR SAMITI
ngoList.detailsOfAchievement: Sugam Sahitya Sanchar Samiti is social-cultural-literal organisation formed in 1974 during J.P. Movement by Renowned poet of Bihar (Late) Ram Niwas Sharma on 26 May, 1974. During J.P. Movement a poetry published by organisation and written by Kavi Ram Niwas Sharma Janta March was banned for their independent human voice for common man. After this many poetry had been published amongst the audience to improve their voice on social evils. Organisation working very well in society by literal-cultural activity since establishment. Recently from 2012 organisation start a literal-cultural festival Rang March on their establishment ocassion and give a literal-social person Kavi Ram Niwas Sharma Shikhar Samman. Till date Ajit Ganguly, Alok Dhanwa, Jata Shankar Aatrey and Nagendra Mohini have been awarded. Organisation has a commitment for society to work for their development. Recently we are going to publish a tri monthly magazine named Janta March for the voice of common man and their rights. We are going to work on regional art form of our state in many districts.

ngoList.title: SUKH SANSAR
ngoList.detailsOfAchievement: SUKH SANSAR has worked hard for its motto- "Leading towards Happiness" and thus making a difference in the lives of millions of people for the last eight years. Sukh Sansar has its humble contribution in the field of rural development under SGSY. Under SGSY the Self Help Groups (SHGs) are formed and banks acess the credit to most of the SHGs which was a distant dream in past. Basic Orientation Capacity Building and Skill Development of Swarojgaris in rural areas are conducted. Under National Environment Awareness Campaign Programme Sukh Sansar has organized training camps, workshops, rallies as awareness activity and plantation, Vermi Compost as action activity for the last 4 years aided by Ministry of Environment and Forest, Govt. of India. Sukh Sansar organized culture programmes to promote culture activities under the programme of Department of Art, Culture and Youth, Govt. of Bihar. Sukh Sansar has also taken up programmes in the field of Health and Family Welfare, Immunization, Health education, health check-up and awareness camps for cancer. It has also taken up the task of preparing the people to combat against HIV/AIDS. Sukh Sansar has been very active in the field of education, social welfare, cultural programmes, legal awareness, child labour, agriculture & horticulture and environment. It has not lost site of wider prospective of national integration and has contributed in this field too. (For details visit us at http://sukhsansar.patna.googlepages.com)

ngoList.detailsOfAchievement: Surveyed the handicapped people of Bihar. We have also aware the handicapped people of Vaishali district to generate the income for their livelihood. We also organized the health check up camps especially for handicapped people, each second day of every month. We are regularly organized the disabled detection camp in the district for identifying the hidden handicapped person with vocational rehabilitation centre.

sourceOfFunds.purpose: We formed an SHG group of Five Men and Seven women to get financial assistance from us as loan for their livelihood and also repaid. Organize a free distribution of nursery plant camp. In this program distribution of nutritional plant in local area people was done. A training program organizes through the society farmer, in this training we trained to farmer for use of new technique of agriculture work.

Surveyed the handicapped people of Bihar. We have also aware the handicapped people of Vaishali district to generate the income for their livelihood. We also organized the health check up camps especially for handicapped people, each second day of every month. We are regularly organized the disabled detection camp in the district for identifying the hidden handicapped person with vocational rehabilitation centre.

Three one day workshops had been organized to give information about problem and solutions to control the maternity related health issues to Vaishali district to develop socio economic empowerment of women for sustained health promotional activities. We organized the sanitation program in the Vaishali district to develop awareness for cleanness driven rural areas. Our organization has decided to employment sanitation program in all villages of nearby panchayat of our headquarter.

ngoList.detailsOfAchievement: Panchayat Shiksha Abhiyaan is a major program to provide Universal Elementary Education to children through Coaching. This program is implemented uniformly across the country which works with Uphaar Shikshan Kendra. Panchayat Shiksha Abhiyaan is mainly useful for children in the age group of 3 to 14 years. The objective of the program is to make education accessible to every child and improve its quality through a time bound implementation strategy and context-specific planning.

ngoList.detailsOfAchievement: Once recruited, the trainers undergo a â€œTrain the Trainerâ€ (TTT) programand are certified internally before they start training in the class. Periodic training programs that include trainings on, training skills and delivery methodology, trainee psychology and leadership skills etc. help them hone and upgrade their classroom effectiveness. The trainings shall begin with basic Orientation Sessions at the training centre. These include life-skills curriculum imparted to students to build their soft-skills and include, â€¢ Workshop based training sessions on skills like communication, teamwork, assertiveness, work ethics, problem solving, trust and co-operation. â€¢ To be imparted through games, simulation exercises, role plays, discussions and AV support tools â€¢ The life-skills curriculum imparted during the orientation is coupled with counseling sessions for students to be able to adjust to new environment and methodology of training Training â€¢ Curriculum - Technical training is imparted through the curriculum designed for specific modules and trades in consultation with Industries. â€¢ Trainers / Faculty Development: The core training faculty strength of TSVP Skill Academy shall be maintained at the skill development centers. â€¢ Technical / Functional training: The same can be conducted through on the job Industry Interface and Plant / Site visits and Guest Lectures. â€¢ Classroom teaching as well as practical training on appropriate equipment shall form part of the training curriculum. â€¢ The suggested program duration shall be ranging from three (03) to six months (06) of training which includes practical training.

ngoList.detailsOfAchievement: Siwan RIT-YDC center which is being managed by Vikas Bharti since 2003 is one of the two seleceted centres in Bihar which ahs established a network in the remote and interier rural areas with many other youth clubs operational in these places.so this program has effectively created awareness among local youths. Our organisation also successfully manages the central govt.sponsored Kasturba Gandhi Balika Vidhyalaya in one of the block of Siwan dist. since 2006. Six workshops concerning different aspect of rights and roles of women representative of panchyati raj institution were successfully organised which was sponsored by HUNGER project, New Delhi. Apart from this , under TAHA programme vikas bharti worked to enhance participation of Rural Youths to contain the spread of HIV-AIDS and stop trafficking.Awarness campaign on environment and climate was also organised by us, facilitated by Ministry of Environment and forests ,under NEAC(National Environment Awareness Campaign) in which school children were kept main target.
